message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

The paper presents an architecture for an assistive robot that is controlled through a Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) based on the P300 paradigm. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) and Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of closed loop inverse kinematic algorithms and perception modules, which suggests that it may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Computer Vision (cs.CV), and Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-categories.
